titleStmt.title: Proud of my broken heart, since thou did'st break it

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998

lg.l: Proud of my broken heart, since thou didstdid'st break it,
Proud of the pain I did not feel till thee,
Proud of my night, since thou with moons dost slake it,
Not to partake thy passion, my humility.
Thou can'st not boast, like Jesus, drunken without com - <app type="division"><lem><lb/></lem></app> panion -companion
Was the strong cup of anguish brewed for the Nazarene
Thou can'st not pierce tradition with the peerless puncture,
See! I usurped thy crucifix to honor mine!
